repnme.cdata!:
Peru - Second Agricultural Research and
            Extension Adaptable Program Loan (Phase 2) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Agricultural
            Research and Extension Adaptable Program Loan (Phase 2)
            Project for Peru were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was substantial,
            Bank performance was moderately satisfactory, and borrower
            performance was also moderately satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: Reliance on competitive funds to manage
            technology generation and dissemination has its limits, as
            there is also a need to ensure the provision of essential
            public goods such as basic long term research programs.
            Investment in generating demand-driven research alone is
            insufficient to address long-term problems (e.g. human and
            physical capacity) where the allocation of funds to
            strategic research issues is essential for the viability of
            a comprehensive program. There are significant risks
            involved in promoting innovative approaches from outside the
            predominant institutional structures (i.e. national research
            institutes), however, specific circumstances can justify
            such an 'outside' approach although they do not
            eliminate the risk of possible lack of success and
            ownership. Therefore, care should be taken to ensure a broad
            based public-private partnership as well as long term
            institutional and financial sustainability of the model
            after project closure. While it is important to focus on the
            establishment of the funding cycles and tools, eventually
            focus must turn to the development of sustainability through
            private cost recovery, funding partners, and ongoing
            government support. The establishment of an effective system
            for monitoring results at sub-project and project levels
            provided the necessary evidence to argue the value and
            strength of competitive funding for science, technology and
            innovation in the agricultural sector, and to promote the
            ability of local groups to design, implement and monitor
            innovation sub-projects. However, more deliberate care is
            needed to document the ex-post impacts and the careful and
            limited use of control groups to reach clearer conclusions
            on the project impact.

Peru - Second Agricultural Research and

6316295.trustfund:
TF094686-GENDER DIFFERENTIATED IMPACT IN
            THE INCAGRO PROJECT,TF052813-PHRD-PERU: AGRICULTURAL

6316295.majtheme: Social dev/gender/inclusion,Environment and natural resource management,Rural development

repnme.cdata!:
Peru - Agricultural Research and Extension
            Project : Adaptable Program Loan

abstracts.cdata!:
The Agricultural Research and Extension
            Project for Peru aims at contributing to the expansion,
            strengthening, and institutional development of the rural
            agricultural technology and innovation system so it is
            pluralistic, decentralized, demand driven, and led by the
            private sector. The project has the following four
            components: Component 1) will advance the development of a
            decentralized market for professional services for
            agricultural innovation. It will strengthen producer
            organizations as beneficiaries of quality services, and
            improve entrepreneurial capacity of private service
            providers. Component 2) will strengthen agricultural
            research and technological development for innovation in
            strategic areas of national importance, and to strengthen
            institutional and professional competence. Component 3) will
            develop the institutional capacity of the public sector to
            formulate and implement agricultural innovation policy in
            conjunction with the private sector, and regulate the
            quality of the National Agricultural Innovation System
            (NAIS). Component 4) will finance the present Research and
            Extension Project for Innovation and Competitiveness in
            Peruvian Agriculture (INCAGRO)-Project Management Unit
            (PMU), which would continue to be the implementing agency
            for Phase II.
